ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class taught not only the fundamentals of playwriting, but how to embrace and celebrate our common humanity. I learned how to write freely, challenge my inner critic, and engage with different theatrical techniques, and through having my work read out loud, I learned so much about my own writing style.
I developed the ability to give good feedback, to write more and to like what I write.
I learned a lot about playwriting as an art form and where my voice could go with it. I also got a grip on what my voice sounds like as a writer and what I'm trying to say.

This course was one of the must fulfilling courses I have taken at Yale College. Professor Margolin is a wonderful professor and incredible playwright. Participating in her class taught me more about playwriting than I could ever have hoped for, and allowed me to explore my writing in a safe and incredibly creative atmosphere.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class is absolutely spectacular. The classroom was such a safe space for growth and exploration, and Deb is an incredible professor.
I honestly loved everything about the course.
Deb Margolin is the best professor at this university. Truly. She is a treasure and a beautiful human that offers her students with so much knowledge and kindness.

Strengths: free writing, reading each other's work, creating a syllabus in class by way of reading plays that we chose to bring into class every week, class play, strong class investment in each other as people and as writers
Weaknesses: a more concrete calendar of who is reading what they wrote and when could've been helpful
While the class focused mostly on creating opportunities for generation (it was a generative workshop) I do wish that more time had been spent analysing plays and playwriting techniques.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Everyone who can should take this course!! The environment in the classroom is the best Ive experienced at Yale, and I grew so much as a writer and a human being.

Yes. Regardless of if youre an English or TAPS major, Deb is certain that you have a story to tell and she is always right. You dont need to know much about playwriting to get a lot out of the course.
If you can take a playwriting class with Deb, you absolutely should. Truly such an artistically fulfilling and enjoyable experience, I loved every second of it.
